<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/28/biden-lays-american-families-plan-primetime-address?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Biden Completes the Trilogy
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/28/biden-lays-american-families-plan-primetime-address" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Biden congress speech" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80ODk3L2JpZGVuX2NvbmdyZXNzX3NwZWVjaC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Melina Mara-Pool/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In a primetime address to Congress last night, President Biden touted his <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/us-policy/2021/04/28/biden-american-families-plan/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">American Families Plan</a>, the third huge spending proposal Biden’s introduced in his 99 days in office.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The key parts of the plan: </strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Universal preschool for 3- and 4-year olds, and two years of tuition-free community college for every American.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A paid leave program for new parents, a permanent expanded child tax credit, and subsidized child care for low- and middle-income families. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The numbers:</strong> $1.8 trillion price tag = $1 trillion in new spending + $800 billion in tax credits.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">How he’s going to fund it </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you ask where the oysters are from, you’ll probably <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/biden-to-propose-1-8-trillion-plan-aimed-at-families-tax-hikes-for-wealthiest-americans-11619600400?mod=hp_lead_pos1" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pay more in taxes</a>. Biden’s plan includes a) bumping up the top income tax rate from 37% to 39.6% b) nearly doubling the capital gains tax for wealthy investors, and c) giving more resources to the IRS to crack down on tax avoiders. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“It’s time for corporate America and the wealthiest 1% of Americans to pay their fair share,” Biden said.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Taken with the president’s <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/04/28/us/politics/biden-spending-plans.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">two other spending proposals</a>, the American Families Plan represents his administration’s view that the federal government can and should play a significant role in shaping the US economy. Here’s a quick review of the other two bills: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">The American Rescue Plan: </strong></span><span>This was the $1.9 trillion Covid-19 relief bill Congress passed in March. It sent $1,400 in direct payments to most Americans and extended additional unemployment benefits through the summer.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">The American Jobs Plan: </strong></span><span>This infrastructure-focused plan pledges $2.3 trillion to shore up the nation’s roads and transit systems, and invests in next-gen building blocks like electric vehicle charging stations. It’s still being negotiated on Capitol Hill. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Republicans think this $6+ trillion in spending is too fast, too furious, and they sure don’t like the tax hikes. But while GOP lawmakers will likely be able to wrangle concessions from the infrastructure bill, experts say the American Families Bill could pass with <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-04-28/biden-can-go-without-republicans-on-families-plan-experts-say?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">just Democratic support</a>.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CRYPTOCURRENCY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/28/ethereum-hits-record-high?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Ethereummmm…?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Spongebob thinking" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=503 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/lKXEBR8m1jWso/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Spongebob thinking" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/lKXEBR8m1jWso/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The cryptocurrency ether hit a <a href="https://www.reuters.com/technology/digital-currency-ether-hits-record-high-2021-04-27/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">record high</a> of $2,714 yesterday. The spike follows Tuesday’s announcement that the European Investment Bank will sell bonds on the Ethereum network, with the aid of Goldman Sachs, Banco Santander, and Society Generale. Plus, Visa announced it’ll <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-04-02/ether-rises-to-record-as-crypto-rally-broadens-beyond-bitcoin?sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">settle transactions</a> using Ethereum earlier this month. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Basically, Ethereum is getting Big Finance’s seal of approval.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Just like at Costco, there’s nothing to be ashamed of if you’re feeling lost here. Ethereum is <a href="https://ethereum.org/en/what-is-ethereum/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the blockchain network</a> that conducts transactions using ether, the name of its cryptocurrency. In other words, no central authority controls ether in the way the Fed controls the US dollar. That decentralization is what makes crypto, crypto. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So what can you do with Ethereum? Run exchanges, take out loans, send ether to family and friends, and more. Most non-fungible tokens (NFTs) run on its tech, too, like CryptoKitties’ digital cat platform.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Some, like <em>Shark Tank</em>’s Kevin O’Leary, think ether will <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/04/28/kevin-oleary-on-crypto-ethereum-is-number-two-next-to-bitcoin.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">always be the silver</a> to bitcoin’s gold. Right now, one bitcoin = more than 20 ether.</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/28/samsung-heirs-agree-pay-biggest-inheritance-tax-ever?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
A Galaxy S21 Ultra-Sized Tax
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/28/samsung-heirs-agree-pay-biggest-inheritance-tax-ever" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Jay Y. Lee, Samsung's vice chairman" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80ODk2L2pheV95X2xlZV9zYW1zdW5nX3NfdmljZV9jaGFpcm1hbi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Samsung Vice Chairman Jay Y. Lee. Chung Sung-Jun/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Samsung heirs said they’ll pay approximately one Cave of Wonders in inheritance tax following the death of Samsung chairman and family head Lee Kun-hee last year. Ringing in at $10.8 billion, it’s the <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/2e764ff1-1f30-4d5b-b671-383ea205365f?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">biggest inheritance tax</a>...ever.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The family will also donate 23,000 artworks and antiques that make most museums look like glorified Beanie Baby collections, featuring Dalí, Monet, Picasso, Park Soo-keun, Lee Jung-seob, and many other iconic artists.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">They said the donations will “uphold [Lee Kun-hee’s] legacy and contribute to the creation of a better society.”</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">“Uphold his legacy” = “overhaul his reputation”</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Lee Kun-hee was sentenced to three years in prison after <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/04/28/business/korea-samsung-taxes.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">evading taxes</a> on a then-secret inheritance from his father. And the family scandals didn’t stop there: Lee Kun-hee’s son Lee Jae-yong (above) served one year behind bars for bribery. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>South Korea is looking forward to a windfall the family says is “three to four times the government’s total estate tax revenue last year.” It’ll collect the $10.8 billion across six payments over five years, giving the country’s richest family time to gather a) bank loans b) cash from dividends, and possibly c) divestments from Samsung holdings.</p>

<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>LinkedIn did more than <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/04/27/microsoft-linkedin-topped-3-billion-in-ad-revenue-in-last-year.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$3 billion in ad revenue</a> during the year ending March 31, Microsoft said Tuesday. That’s more annual ad revenue than Snap or Pinterest.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“That’s incorrect.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On the <em>Today</em> show, Dr. Anthony Fauci <a href="https://www.axios.com/fauci-joe-rogan-covid-vaccine-incorrect-podcast-7552139d-6134-46cf-a1eb-20e12ea705ee.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">responded</a> to podcaster Joe Rogan who said that healthy, young people should not get the Covid-19 vaccine. Dr. Fauci pushed back, saying that even though young people may not develop symptoms or serious illness, they could become vectors for the coronavirus and spread it to more vulnerable populations. He said young people should “absolutely” get vaccinated.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>How to have better arguments online. <table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/28/tractor-supply-credits-strong-q1-earnings-millennials-moving-suburban-rural-areas?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Millennials Cause a Chicken Boom
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/28/tractor-supply-credits-strong-q1-earnings-millennials-moving-suburban-rural-areas" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Egg carton in a house" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80ODk0L2VnZ19ob3VzZS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><em>Francis Scialabba</em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Tractor Supply, the rural US retailer famous for carrying everything except tractors, said that half of the 11 million chickens it sold in 2020 were to new customers. CEO Hal Lawton <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/04/28/business/tractor-supply-millennials/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">credited</a> the surge to millennials moving from big cities and upgrading their sad window herb boxes to backyard coops in suburbs and less-populated areas. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>If it feels like all your friends are living their <em>Little House on the Prairie</em> fantasies, it’s because they are. Homeownership rates are growing fastest among people under 44, and in February, rural population growth among millennials increased 3%, according to Prevedere.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“I think all of us have been wondering if that generation will eventually conform to normal generational activities like householding,” Lawton said about millennials during the company’s </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-04-28/chickens-millennials-weisenthal-odd-lots?sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">earnings call</a></span><span>, where the company also reported a 42.5% total sales increase YoY. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>as big cities that emptied out at the start of the pandemic open back up, Tractor Supply isn’t worried about young people ditching the simple life. The retailer plans to open 80 new stores in 2021.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GAMES
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Three Headlines and a Lie
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you’re not sure what to talk about on your first post-vaccine date, try bringing up some of these wild headlines—but just know that only three of them are real. Can you (or your date) guess which is the faker?</p>
<ol style="list-style-type: lower-alpha;">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“Prancer, the </span><span><a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/04/27/991376581/prancer-the-haunted-victorian-child-dog-from-viral-ad-has-been-adopted?utm_term=nprnews&utm_source=twitter.com&utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=npr" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">‘Haunted Victorian Child</a></span><span>’ dog from viral ad, has been adopted”</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“Arizona town </span><span><a href="https://media1.giphy.com/media/ILyoSIDmYONBm/giphy.gif?cid=ecf05e47eb0hs0hbxbh02ex19nyb1hi62tj11djdp6v9xgg4&rid=giphy.gif&ct=g" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">protests</a></span><span> plant-based meat with a Beyond Meat food fight”</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“‘Creature’ </span><span><a href="https://www.fox5atlanta.com/news/creature-lurking-in-tree-terrorizing-poland-town-turns-out-to-be-a-croissant-stuck-in-a-tree?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">terrorizing</a></span><span> Poland town turns out to be a croissant stuck in a tree”</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“Tyrannosaurus rex </span><span><a href="https://edition.cnn.com/2021/04/20/world/t-rex-walked-slowly-study-scn/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">walked</a></span><span> surprisingly slowly, new study finds”</span>

style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nBiden Completes the Trilogy\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eMelina Mara-Pool/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn a primetime address to Congress last night, President Biden touted his \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/us-policy/2021/04/28/biden-american-families-plan/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eAmerican Families Plan\u003c/a\u003e, the third huge spending proposal Biden’s introduced in his 99 days in office.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe key parts of the plan: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eUniversal preschool for 3- and 4-year olds, and two years of tuition-free community college for every American.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eA paid leave program for new parents, a permanent expanded child tax credit, and subsidized child care for low- and middle-income families. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe numbers:\u003c/strong\u003e $1.8 trillion price tag = $1 trillion in new spending + $800 billion in tax credits.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eHow he’s going to fund it \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf you ask where the oysters are from, you’ll probably \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/biden-to-propose-1-8-trillion-plan-aimed-at-families-tax-hikes-for-wealthiest-americans-11619600400?mod=hp_lead_pos1\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epay more in taxes\u003c/a\u003e. Biden’s plan includes a) bumping up the top income tax rate from 37% to 39.6% b) nearly doubling the capital gains tax for wealthy investors, and c) giving more resources to the IRS to crack down on tax avoiders. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“It’s time for corporate America and the wealthiest 1% of Americans to pay their fair share,” Biden said.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eTaken with the president’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/04/28/us/politics/biden-spending-plans.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etwo other spending proposals\u003c/a\u003e, the American Families Plan represents his administration’s view that the federal government can and should play a significant role in shaping the US economy. Here’s a quick review of the other two bills: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe American Rescue Plan: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThis was the $1.9 trillion Covid-19 relief bill Congress passed in March. It sent $1,400 in direct payments to most Americans and extended additional unemployment benefits through the summer.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe American Jobs Plan: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThis infrastructure-focused plan pledges $2.3 trillion to shore up the nation’s roads and transit systems, and invests in next-gen building blocks like electric vehicle charging stations. It’s still being negotiated on Capitol Hill. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eRepublicans think this $6+ trillion in spending is too fast, too furious, and they sure don’t like the tax hikes. But while GOP lawmakers will likely be able to wrangle concessions from the infrastructure bill, experts say the American Families Bill could pass with \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-04-28/biden-can-go-without-republicans-on-families-plan-experts-say?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ejust Democratic support\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe cryptocurrency ether hit a \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/technology/digital-currency-ether-hits-record-high-2021-04-27/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erecord high\u003c/a\u003e of $2,714 yesterday. The spike follows Tuesday’s announcement that the European Investment Bank will sell bonds on the Ethereum network, with the aid of Goldman Sachs, Banco Santander, and Society Generale. Plus, Visa announced it’ll \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-04-02/ether-rises-to-record-as-crypto-rally-broadens-beyond-bitcoin?sref=KkPzpZvz\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esettle transactions\u003c/a\u003e using Ethereum earlier this month. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBasically, Ethereum is getting Big Finance’s seal of approval.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eJust like at Costco, there’s nothing to be ashamed of if you’re feeling lost here. Ethereum is \u003ca href=\"https://ethereum.org/en/what-is-ethereum/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethe blockchain network\u003c/a\u003e that conducts transactions using ether, the name of its cryptocurrency. In other words, no central authority controls ether in the way the Fed controls the US dollar. That decentralization is what makes crypto, crypto. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSo what can you do with Ethereum? Run exchanges, take out loans, send ether to family and friends, and more. Most non-fungible tokens (NFTs) run on its tech, too, like CryptoKitties’ digital cat platform.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eSome, like \u003cem\u003eShark Tank\u003c/em\u003e’s Kevin O’Leary, think ether will \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/04/28/kevin-oleary-on-crypto-ethereum-is-number-two-next-to-bitcoin.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ealways be the silver\u003c/a\u003e to bitcoin’s gold. Ringing in at $10.8 billion, it’s the \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/2e764ff1-1f30-4d5b-b671-383ea205365f?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebiggest inheritance tax\u003c/a\u003e...ever.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe family will also donate 23,000 artworks and antiques that make most museums look like glorified Beanie Baby collections, featuring Dalí, Monet, Picasso, Park Soo-keun, Lee Jung-seob, and many other iconic artists.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThey said the donations will “uphold [Lee Kun-hee’s] legacy and contribute to the creation of a better society.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003e“Uphold his legacy” = “overhaul his reputation”\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLee Kun-hee was sentenced to three years in prison after \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/04/28/business/korea-samsung-taxes.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eevading taxes\u003c/a\u003e on a then-secret inheritance from his father. And the family scandals didn’t stop there: Lee Kun-hee’s son Lee Jae-yong (above) served one year behind bars for bribery. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eSouth Korea is looking forward to a windfall the family says is “three to four times the government’s total estate tax revenue last year.” It’ll collect the $10.8 billion across six payments over five years, giving the country’s richest family time to gather a) bank loans b) cash from dividends, and possibly c) divestments from Samsung holdings.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTractor Supply, the rural US retailer famous for carrying everything except tractors, said that half of the 11 million chickens it sold in 2020 were to new customers. CEO Hal Lawton \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2021/04/28/business/tractor-supply-millennials/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecredited\u003c/a\u003e the surge to millennials moving from big cities and upgrading their sad window herb boxes to backyard coops in suburbs and less-populated areas. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eIf it feels like all your friends are living their \u003cem\u003eLittle House on the Prairie\u003c/em\u003e fantasies, it’s because they are. Homeownership rates are growing fastest among people under 44, and in February, rural population growth among millennials increased 3%, according to Prevedere.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e“I think all of us have been wondering if that generation will eventually conform to normal generational activities like householding,” Lawton said about millennials during the company’s \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-04-28/chickens-millennials-weisenthal-odd-lots?sref=KkPzpZvz\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eearnings call\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, where the company also reported a 42.5% total sales increase YoY. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eas big cities that emptied out at the start of the pandemic open back up, Tractor Supply isn’t worried about young people ditching the simple life.
